sn45.6:4.2: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha …
sn45.6:4.4: “Sir, they speak of this thing called the ‘spiritual path’.
sn45.6:4.5: What is the spiritual path? And what is the culmination of the spiritual path?”
sn45.6:5.1: “Mendicant, the spiritual path is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn45.6:5.2: right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right samādhi.
sn45.6:5.4: The ending of greed, hate, and delusion.
sn45.6:5.5: This is the culmination of the spiritual path.”
